meta.name: Gmail MCP Workflow - AI-Powered Email Management

nodes.name: MCP Server Trigger
nodes.notes:
üöÄ MCP TRIGGER

This is the entry point for AI interactions with Gmail. The MCP (Model Context Protocol) trigger allows AI models to call any of the connected Gmail tools based on user requests.

Key Features:
‚Ä¢ Enables natural language Gmail commands
‚Ä¢ Routes AI requests to appropriate Gmail operations
‚Ä¢ Provides context-aware email management
‚Ä¢ Supports complex multi-step email workflows

nodes.name: Gmail - Send Email
nodes.notes:
üìß SEND EMAIL

Compose and send emails through AI commands. The AI extracts recipient, subject, and message content from natural language requests.

Use Cases:
‚Ä¢ "Send an email to john@example.com about the meeting"
‚Ä¢ "Compose a follow-up email to the client"
‚Ä¢ "Send a thank you note to the team"

AI Parameters:
‚Ä¢ To: Email recipient(s)
‚Ä¢ Subject: Email subject line
‚Ä¢ Message: Email body content

nodes.name: Gmail - Get Email
nodes.notes:
üìñ READ EMAIL

Retrieve and read email content by message ID. Perfect for AI to analyze, summarize, or extract information from specific emails.

Use Cases:
‚Ä¢ "Read the latest email from Sarah"
‚Ä¢ "Get the content of message ID 123456"
‚Ä¢ "Show me the email about the project update"

Returns:
‚Ä¢ Full email content
‚Ä¢ Headers and metadata
‚Ä¢ Attachments information
‚Ä¢ Thread context

nodes.name: Gmail - Mark Unread
nodes.notes:
üëÅÔ∏è MARK AS UNREAD

Mark emails as unread to ensure they get attention later. Useful for emails that need follow-up or further action.

Use Cases:
‚Ä¢ "Mark that important email as unread"
‚Ä¢ "I need to revisit this email later"
‚Ä¢ "Flag this message for follow-up"

Best Practices:
‚Ä¢ Use for emails requiring action
‚Ä¢ Combine with labels for better organization
‚Ä¢ Great for creating manual reminders

nodes.name: Gmail - Add Labels
nodes.notes:
üè∑Ô∏è ADD LABELS

Organize emails by adding labels for better categorization and workflow management.

Use Cases:
‚Ä¢ "Label this email as 'Important'"
‚Ä¢ "Add 'Project-X' label to recent emails"
‚Ä¢ "Categorize this as 'Follow-up Required'"

AI Parameters:
‚Ä¢ Message_ID: Target email ID
‚Ä¢ Label_Names_or_IDs: Labels to apply

Tip: Use descriptive labels for AI-driven organization

nodes.name: Gmail - Mark Read
nodes.notes:
‚úÖ MARK AS READ

Mark emails as read to maintain inbox organization and track processed messages.

Use Cases:
‚Ä¢ "Mark all emails from today as read"
‚Ä¢ "I've processed this email, mark it read"
‚Ä¢ "Clean up my unread messages"

Automation Ideas:
‚Ä¢ Auto-mark newsletters as read
‚Ä¢ Mark processed support tickets
‚Ä¢ Bulk mark promotional emails

nodes.name: Gmail - Remove Labels
nodes.notes:
üóëÔ∏è REMOVE LABELS

Remove labels from emails to update categorization or clean up organization system.

Use Cases:
‚Ä¢ "Remove 'Urgent' label from this email"
‚Ä¢ "Clean up old project labels"
‚Ä¢ "Update email categorization"

AI Parameters:
‚Ä¢ Message_ID: Target email ID
‚Ä¢ Label_Names_or_IDs: Labels to remove

Workflow Tip: Combine with add labels for label migration

parameters.content:
## üöÄ MCP TRIGGER EXPLANATION

**What it does:**
This is the entry point for AI interactions with Gmail. The MCP (Model Context Protocol) trigger allows AI models to call any of the connected Gmail tools based on user requests.

**Key Features:**
‚Ä¢ Enables natural language Gmail commands
‚Ä¢ Routes AI requests to appropriate Gmail operations
‚Ä¢ Provides context-aware email management
‚Ä¢ Supports complex multi-step email workflows

**Example Commands:**
"Send an email to john@example.com"
"Mark the latest email as important"
"Read my unread messages"

## üìß SEND EMAIL

**Purpose:**
Compose and send emails through AI commands. The AI extracts recipient, subject, and message content from natural language requests.

**Use Cases:**
‚Ä¢ "Send an email to john@example.com about the meeting"
‚Ä¢ "Compose a follow-up email to the client"
‚Ä¢ "Send a thank you note to the team"

**AI Parameters:**
‚Ä¢ **To:** Email recipient(s)
‚Ä¢ **Subject:** Email subject line
‚Ä¢ **Message:** Email body content

## üìñ READ EMAIL

**Purpose:**
Retrieve and read email content by message ID. Perfect for AI to analyze, summarize, or extract information from specific emails.

**Use Cases:**
‚Ä¢ "Read the latest email from Sarah"
‚Ä¢ "Get the content of message ID 123456"
‚Ä¢ "Show me the email about the project update"

**Returns:**
‚Ä¢ Full email content
‚Ä¢ Headers and metadata
‚Ä¢ Attachments information
‚Ä¢ Thread context

## üëÅÔ∏è MARK AS UNREAD

**Purpose:**
Mark emails as unread to ensure they get attention later. Useful for emails that need follow-up or further action.

**Use Cases:**
‚Ä¢ "Mark that important email as unread"
‚Ä¢ "I need to revisit this email later"
‚Ä¢ "Flag this message for follow-up"

**Best Practices:**
‚Ä¢ Use for emails requiring action
‚Ä¢ Combine with labels for better organization
‚Ä¢ Great for creating manual reminders

## üè∑Ô∏è ADD LABELS

**Purpose:**
Organize emails by adding labels for better categorization and workflow management.

**Use Cases:**
‚Ä¢ "Label this email as 'Important'"
‚Ä¢ "Add 'Project-X' label to recent emails"
‚Ä¢ "Categorize this as 'Follow-up Required'"

**AI Parameters:**
‚Ä¢ **Message_ID:** Target email ID
‚Ä¢ **Label_Names_or_IDs:** Labels to apply

**Tip:** Use descriptive labels for AI-driven organization

## ‚úÖ MARK AS READ

**Purpose:**
Mark emails as read to maintain inbox organization and track processed messages.

**Use Cases:**
‚Ä¢ "Mark all emails from today as read"
‚Ä¢ "I've processed this email, mark it read"
‚Ä¢ "Clean up my unread messages"

**Automation Ideas:**
‚Ä¢ Auto-mark newsletters as read
‚Ä¢ Mark processed support tickets
‚Ä¢ Bulk mark promotional emails

## üóëÔ∏è REMOVE LABELS

**Purpose:**
Remove labels from emails to update categorization or clean up organization system.

**Use Cases:**
‚Ä¢ "Remove 'Urgent' label from this email"
‚Ä¢ "Clean up old project labels"
‚Ä¢ "Update email categorization"

**AI Parameters:**
‚Ä¢ **Message_ID:** Target email ID
‚Ä¢ **Label_Names_or_IDs:** Labels to remove

**Workflow Tip:** Combine with add labels for label migration

## üéØ WORKFLOW OVERVIEW

**Gmail MCP - AI-Powered Email Management**

This workflow provides a complete toolkit for intelligent email management through AI interactions using the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

**Core Capabilities:**
‚Ä¢ üìß Send personalized emails
‚Ä¢ üìñ Read and analyze email content
‚Ä¢ üè∑Ô∏è Organize with smart labeling
‚Ä¢ ‚úÖ Manage read/unread status
‚Ä¢ ü§ñ Natural language commands

**Getting Started:**
1. Ensure Gmail OAuth2 is configured
2. Test each tool individually
3. Use natural language with your AI
4. Monitor workflow execution logs
